intro: Brevilongium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, lance-shaped leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Brevilongium has a compact growth habit and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
